item.title: John add a quote by Balzac
item.description: "I am not deep, but I am very wide." -- Balzac

item.title: John add a quote by Theodore Parker
item.description: "I do not pretend to understand the moral universe; the arc is a long one, my eye reaches but little ways; I cannot calculate the curve and complete the figure by the experience of sight, I can divine it by conscience. And from what I see I am sure it bends towards justice." -- Theodore Parker

item.title: John add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Some people never go crazy. What truly horrible lives they must lead." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: John add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description:
"Do you hate people?
I don't hate them...I just feel better when they're not around." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: John add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "For those who believe in God, most of the big questions are answered. But for those of us who can't readily accept the God formula, the big answers don't remain stone-written. We adjust to new conditions and discoveries. We are pliable. Love need not be a command nor faith a dictum. I am my own god. We are here to unlearn the teachings of the church, state, and our educational system. We are here to drink beer. We are here to kill war. We are here to laugh at the odds and live our lives so well that Death will tremble to take us." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: John add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "what matters most is how well you walk through the fire" -- Charles Bukowski
